review_title: Senior leadership sinking the whole ship
pros: Many of the staff are lovely. The work is meaningful. Nice to work for an LGBTQ+ organisation.
cons: Low pay, ridiculous work loads, and virtually none of the infrastructure (systems, equipment, members of staff) you would legitimately expect from a charity with a turnover of over £5m. The charity says it's trying to fix its history of racism & needs everyone on board to do that, but at the same time the majority white senior leadership team aren't willing to renumerate POC staff for their time and expertise. Senior leadership team are also willing to shoot the messenger when people threaten the status quo. But the status quo needs to change for the charity to have a chance at surviving the next few years. People who have spoken out have been made redundant or had probation periods extended for very flimsy reasons. Staff have the choice of carrying on as if the current situation is OK (it isn't) or speaking up about problems and suggesting improvements but risking their jobs in the process.
